title: Anomaly Detection and Localization for Speech Deepfakes via Feature Pyramid Matching
author: Emma Coletta (Dipartimento di Elettronica, Informazione e Bioingegneria, Politecnico di Milano), Davide Salvi (Dipartimento di Elettronica, Informazione e Bioingegneria, Politecnico di Milano), Viola Negroni (Dipartimento di Elettronica, Informazione e Bioingegneria, Politecnico di Milano), Daniele Ugo Leonzio (Dipartimento di Elettronica, Informazione e Bioingegneria, Politecnico di Milano), Paolo Bestagini (Dipartimento di Elettronica, Informazione e Bioingegneria, Politecnico di Milano), ...
relevance_why: This work on the detection of speech deepfakes could inform similar tasks in audio classification, particularly in handling anomalies in audio data and improving robustness against synthetic audio manipulations.
background: Detecting and localizing anomalies in speech to differentiate real signals from potentially manipulated deepfake signals.
contribution: This paper introduces an interpretable One-Class anomaly detection framework to solve speech deepfake detection, achieving superior performance and generalization capabilities over traditional supervised models.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing detection methods rely heavily on supervised learning approaches, which are limited in their ability to generalize to unseen synthesis techniques.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves detection by leveraging a One-Class learning model trained exclusively on authentic data, allowing it to identify synthetic instances effectively.

key_innovation: The use of Student-Teacher Feature Pyramid Matching for feature alignment and anomaly localization enhances both detection accuracy and model interpretability.
real_world_impact: This framework addresses crucial security concerns related to speech deepfakes, enhancing the reliability of audio communications and potentially aiding in legal and fraud detection contexts.

new_terms.Feature Pyramid Matching: **Feature Pyramid Matching** refers to a technique used to align features at multiple levels of a neural network to improve the discrimination power against anomalies.
new_terms.One-Class Learning: **One-Class Learning** is a machine learning approach where a model is trained only on one class of data, learning its distribution to identify anomalies or outliers.
